title: Real-Time Blind Inpainting via Multi-Instance Beta-Process Factor Analysis
content: In recent years, dictionary-based inpainting methods have been shown to successfully recover spatially sub-sampled acquisitions, such as in the field of low-dose scanning transmission electron microscopy (STEM) [1-3]. Spatially sub-sampled STEM measurements allow for a reduction in the electron fluence necessary to recover a fully sampled image of a sample [4], and the increased spatio-temporal distance between adjacent measurements reduces the overlap of the beam diffusion processes [5]. This capability has motivated our research into increasingly more computationally efficient implementations of dictionary learning and sparse-coding methods for inpainting/reconstructing subsampled measurements, with the goal of achieving real-time reconstructions of a time-variable sub-sampled STEM video feed, necessary due to the significant electron exposure which can arise during the alignment of a STEM.
